title.narrative: Waste to Energy in Phnom Penh

description.narrative: The project objective is to facilitate investment in a Refuse Derived Fuel (RDF) plant in Phnom Penh and subsequently replace coal with RDF at the cement manufacturing in Cambodia and this project is aligned with IO2. Increased green growth investment flows which enable partner governments to implement green growth policies.

The project will support government counterparts in assessing technical feasibility of the RDF plant, and in designing a suitable procurement and contractual set-up for a PPP through an auction mechanism for a Build-Own-Operate-Transfer (BOOT) contract. As the biggest city in Cambodia, Phnom Penh is the ideal candidate for such a project as it generates enough volume of municipal and industrial solid waste, within a relatively small area. There is no large-scale recycling facility in Phnom Penh and no source segregation of waste, apart from informal collection of some recyclables. Therefore, WtE represents a suitable option to deal with such mixed waste streams in large scale. The model is potentially replicable in larger cities in GGGI member countries.

participating-org.narrative: National Council for Sustainable Development, Phnom Penh Capital Hall

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04520 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Dollar amount for project financing agreed

Prefeasibilty completed "• Establish an engagement plan (in-house) • Technical and financial pre-feasibility (in-house) • Project initiation workshop • Study visit to Thailand • Cement Sector Engagement (in-house) • Market sounding with possible bidders and investment barriers analysis (in-house) • Establishment of a cross ministerial committee"
Go/No Go decision made by gov, GGGI and partners

Feasibilty and auctoin completed "• Pre-design of the auction framework and mechanism
• Full technical feasibility & term sheet templates • Develop project flowchart, revenues and benefits sharing mechanism (in-house) • Detailed auction framework • Develop financial term sheet and bidder criteria • Development of full auction design documents • Auction organization and post auction activities"
The winner of the tender is rewarded to the contract.
Reduction in solid waste dumping and a consequential reduction in coal use for energy generation, resulting in environment, public health and economic benefits.

description.narrative: "1. Government 2. Local Admistration 3. Cement industry + audits"

title.narrative: Tonnes of waste processed per day
